page.title: 17LOWESWATER SHOW DAY 19-9-85
page.content: The children of Lamplugh School were invited to the show to make a reprt for the Domesday project. The show was set in field with Melbreak behind. On 18-9-85 there was 4cm rain, we thought the show might be cancelled. We were lucky with the weather it was a wet morning followed by a dry afternoon. The show field was very muddy most people wore wellington boots, some wore plastic bags over their shoes. One gateway was really muddy, we squelched around in it. The mud was made worse by tractors and horses and carts going up and down the field. part of the field was flooded, we enjoyed wading in it, it was quite deep. Some of us made a live broadcast on Radio Cumbria, we had a good day. At the end of the day cars were getting stuck as they left so we helped by pushing them off the field.
